description: xeno- +â€Ž morphosis, coined by American filmmaker and author Nick Zedd (born 1958).

entries.meaning: (film studies) A form of cognitive dissonance produced by stimulation that pulls in two opposing directions, such as simultaneous attraction and revulsion.
examples: Xenomorphosis occurs when the empirical elements of projected sound and image conspire to negate and destroy, through the retina, neuro-pathways designed to domesticate and tranquilize.
